com.zebra.sdk.common.card.graphics

Class ZebraCardGraphics

  • Object
    • com.zebra.sdk.common.card.graphics.ZebraCardGraphics
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ZebraGraphics, ZebraGraphicsI, Cloneable

    public class ZebraCardGraphics
extends Object
implements ZebraGraphics, Cloneable
    Used to construct the graphics for Card printers.

      • ZebraCardGraphics

        public ZebraCardGraphics(ZebraCardPrinter genericPrinter)
                  throws ConnectionException,
                         ZebraCardException
        Public Constructor to construct the ZebraCardGraphics object.
        Parameters:
        genericPrinter - an instance of a zebra card printer.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if the device is busy or an error occurs communicating with the printer.
        ZebraCardException - if a printer error occurs.

        public void initialize(int maxWidth,
              int maxHeight,
              OrientationType orientation,
              PrintType printType,
              Integer fillColor)
        Description copied from interface: ZebraGraphicsI
        Initializes the drawing surface
        • if the specified maxWidth or maxHeight is 0 then the maximum values for the specified printer model will be used
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface ZebraGraphicsI
        Parameters:
        maxWidth - the maximum width of the image (limited based on printer model).
        maxHeight - the maximum height of the image (limited based on printer model).
        orientation - the orientation of the image.
        printType - the type of print to be performed.
        fillColor - the RGB background fill color.
        See Also:
        ZebraGraphicsI.initialize(int, int, OrientationType, PrintType, Integer)

      • setBrightnessLevel

        public void setBrightnessLevel(int level)
        Description copied from interface: ZebraGraphicsI
        Sets the brightness correction level to be applied during ZebraGraphicsI.createImage()
        Specified by:
        setBrightnessLevel in interface ZebraGraphicsI
        Parameters:
        level - the brightness level.
        • Range: -25 to 25
        • Values passed in (-25 to 25) will be converted to a range of -127 to 127 before being applied to each pixel (e.g. a value of 25 will correspond to an actual offset of 127).
        See Also:
        ZebraGraphicsI.setBrightnessLevel(int)

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(byte[] imageData,
             int x,
             int y,
             int width,
             int height,
             RotationType rotation)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: ZebraGraphicsI
        Draws the image into the specified rectangle
        Specified by:
        drawImage in interface ZebraGraphicsI
        Parameters:
        imageData - the bitmap image data
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        width - the width of the rectangle.
        • if 0 then the width of the specified image will be used
        height - the height of the rectangle.
        • if 0 then the height of the specified image will be used
        rotation - the rotation of the image.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during reading/writing.
        IllegalArgumentException - if an argument passed in is not valid.
        See Also:

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(byte[] imageData,
             int x,
             int y,
             int width,
             int height,
             float transparency,
             RotationType rotation)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: ZebraGraphics
        Draws the image into the specified rectangle.
        Specified by:
        drawImage in interface ZebraGraphics
        Parameters:
        imageData - the bitmap image data.
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        width - the width of the rectangle.
        • If width is 0 then the width of the specified image will be used.
        height - the height of the rectangle.
        • If height is 0 then the height of the specified image will be used
        transparency - the transparency level.
        • 0.0f = completely opaque
        • 100.0f = completely transparent
        rotation - the rotation type for the image.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the image data.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified transparency level is outside of the valid range.
        See Also:
        ZebraGraphics.drawImage(byte[], int, int, int, int, float, RotationType)

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(byte[] imageData,
             ImagePosition position,
             int width,
             int height,
             float transparency,
             RotationType rotation)
               throws IllegalArgumentException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: ZebraGraphics
        Draws the image at the specified image position in the rectangle.
        Specified by:
        drawImage in interface ZebraGraphics
        Parameters:
        imageData - the bitmap image data.
        position - the position of the image in the rectangle.
        width - the width of the rectangle.
        • If width is 0 then the width of the specified image will be used.
        height - the height of the rectangle.
        • If height is 0 then the height of the specified image will be used.
        transparency - the transparency level.
        • 0.0f = completely opaque
        • 100.0f = completely transparent
        rotation - the rotation type.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified transparency level is outside of the valid range.
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the image data.
        See Also:
        ZebraGraphics.drawImage(byte[], ImagePosition, int, int, float, RotationType)

        public void drawText(String text,
            int x,
            int y,
            int width,
            int height,
            int angle,
            java.awt.Color textColor)
              throws IllegalArgumentException

      • drawText

        public void drawText(String text,
            int x,
            int y,
            int width,
            int height,
            int angle,
            java.awt.Color textColor,
            boolean shrinkToFit)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: ZebraGraphics
        Draws the text into the specified rectangle.
        Specified by:
        drawText in interface ZebraGraphics
        Parameters:
        text - the text to be drawn.
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        width - the width of the rectangle.
        height - the height of the rectangle.
        angle - the angle of the the text to be drawn.
        textColor - the RGB color of the text to be drawn.
        shrinkToFit - True to adjust the font size to fit the specified width and height.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified width and height are not large enough to contain the text and shrinkToFit is false.
        See Also:
        ZebraGraphics.drawText(String, int, int, int, int, int, Color, boolean)

        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        width - the width of the rectangle.
        height - the height of the rectangle.
        lineThickness - the line thickness of the rectangle.
        • the lineThickness will be ignored if the lineColor is null.
        lineColor - the RGB line color of the rectangle.
        • the lineColor will be ignored if null.
        fillColor - the RGB fill color of the rectangle.
        • the fillColor will be ignored if null.
        See Also:
        ZebraGraphics.drawRectangle(int, int, int, int, float, Color, Color)

      • extractBlackImageData

        public ExtractedImages extractBlackImageData(byte[] imageData,
                                    int redThreshold,
                                    int greenThreshold,
                                    int blueThreshold)
                                      throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                             java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: ZebraGraphicsI
        Separates the monochrome and color data from the specified image data using the specified threshold values.
        Specified by:
        extractBlackImageData in interface ZebraGraphicsI
        Parameters:
        imageData - the 24bpp bitmap color image data.
        redThreshold - the red pixel threshold value.
        • Range: 0 to 255
        greenThreshold - the green pixel threshold value.
        • Range: 0 to 255
        blueThreshold - the blue pixel threshold value.
        • Range: 0 to 255
        Returns:
        Images images instance containing the extracted color and monochrome image data.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the redThreshold, greenThreshold, or blueThreshold level is outside of the valid range.
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading the image data.
        See Also:
        ZebraGraphicsI.extractBlackImageData(byte[], int, int, int)

      • extractHalfPanelImageData

        public byte[] extractHalfPanelImageData(byte[] imageData)
                                 throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                        java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: ZebraGraphicsI
        Attempts to identify and extract the color and non-color half panel regions of the source image.
        • ZMotif Series 7 and ZC Series printers only.
        • The printer model must be set prior to calling this method.
        Specified by:
        extractHalfPanelImageData in interface ZebraGraphicsI
        Parameters:
        imageData - the 24bpp bitmap color image data.
        Returns:
        byte[] the extracted half panel color image data.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If imageData is invalid or the printer model is not supported.
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading the image data.
        See Also:
        ZebraGraphicsI.extractHalfPanelImageData(byte[])
